description.raw:
This pull request includes the new redesign of the joint maker (courtesy of @iche033) contained in the model editor. I've fixed the mouse interaction problems and the sdf generation.

The original `JointMaker_TEST` segfaults after running (during tear down). I've commented some of the lines that apparently causes the problem for leaving the test in a stable state. The problem seems to be related with Ogre deallocating the sceneNode and some destructions that we do inside Gazebo. I've been looking into this but I'm not sure why this is happening. Suggestions are more than welcome. Here is a backtrace in case we want to tackle the problem here.

```
#!c++
Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007ffff69969f7 in gazebo::rendering::Visual::DestroyAllAttachedMovableObjects (this=0x417e240, _sceneNode=0x7fffb4709278)
    at /home/caguero/workspace/gazebo_1.9/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc:263
263	    _sceneNode->getAttachedObjectIterator();
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff69969f7 in gazebo::rendering::Visual::DestroyAllAttachedMovableObjects (this=0x417e240, _sceneNode=0x7fffb4709278)
    at /home/caguero/workspace/gazebo_1.9/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc:263
#1  0x00007ffff6996189 in gazebo::rendering::Visual::~Visual (
    this=0x417e240, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /home/caguero/workspace/gazebo_1.9/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc:178
#2  0x00007ffff6996310 in gazebo::rendering::Visual::~Visual (
    this=0x417e240, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /home/caguero/workspace/gazebo_1.9/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc:193
#3  0x00007ffff4a2963c in boost::checked_delete<gazebo::rendering::Visual> (
    x=0x417e240) at /usr/include/boost/checked_delete.hpp:34
#4  0x00007ffff4a37ee8 in boost::detail::sp_counted_impl_p<gazebo::rendering::Visual>::dispose (this=0x418f2a0)
    at /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/detail/sp_counted_impl.hpp:78
#5  0x00007ffff685d7ec in boost::detail::sp_counted_base::release (
    this=0x418f2a0)
    at /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/detail/sp_counted_base_gcc_x86.hpp:146
#6  0x00007ffff685d87b in boost::detail::shared_count::~shared_count (
    this=0x418a888, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/detail/shared_count.hpp:371
#7  0x00007ffff685dc2a in boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::rendering::Visual>::~shared_ptr (this=0x418a880, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:328
#8  0x00007ffff69ac53a in boost::_bi::value<boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::rendering::Visual> >::~value (this=0x418a880, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /usr/include/boost/bind/bind.hpp:112
#9  0x00007ffff69ac554 in boost::_bi::storage1<boost::_bi::value<boost::shared---Type <return> to continue, or q <return> to quit---
_ptr<gazebo::rendering::Visual> > >::~storage1 (this=0x418a880, 
    __in_chrg=<optimized out>) at /usr/include/boost/bind/storage.hpp:40
#10 0x00007ffff69ac56e in boost::_bi::list1<boost::_bi::value<boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::rendering::Visual> > >::~list1 (this=0x418a880, 
    __in_chrg=<optimized out>) at /usr/include/boost/bind/bind.hpp:217

    op=boost::detail::function::destroy_functor_tag)

    this=0x417d7a0, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /usr/include/boost/function/function_template.hpp:1048
#19 0x00007ffff79455f2 in gazebo::event::EventT<void ()>::~EventT() (
    this=0x7ffff7832310 <gazebo::event::Events::preRender>, 
    __in_chrg=<optimized out>)

#20 0x00007ffff3d2b4da in __cxa_finalize (d=0x7ffff7831778)
    at cxa_finalize.c:56
```

description.html:
This pull request includes the new redesign of the joint maker (courtesy of @iche033) contained in the model editor. I've fixed the mouse interaction problems and the sdf generation.

The original JointMaker_TEST segfaults after running (during tear down). I've commented some of the lines that apparently causes the problem for leaving the test in a stable state. The problem seems to be related with Ogre deallocating the sceneNode and some destructions that we do inside Gazebo. I've been looking into this but I'm not sure why this is happening. Suggestions are more than welcome. Here is a backtrace in case we want to tackle the problem here.

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.

description:
This pull request includes the new redesign of the joint maker (courtesy of @iche033) contained in the model editor. I've fixed the mouse interaction problems and the sdf generation.

The original `JointMaker_TEST` segfaults after running (during tear down). I've commented some of the lines that apparently causes the problem for leaving the test in a stable state. The problem seems to be related with Ogre deallocating the sceneNode and some destructions that we do inside Gazebo. I've been looking into this but I'm not sure why this is happening. Suggestions are more than welcome. Here is a backtrace in case we want to tackle the problem here.

```
#!c++
Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007ffff69969f7 in gazebo::rendering::Visual::DestroyAllAttachedMovableObjects (this=0x417e240, _sceneNode=0x7fffb4709278)
    at /home/caguero/workspace/gazebo_1.9/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc:263
263	    _sceneNode->getAttachedObjectIterator();
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff69969f7 in gazebo::rendering::Visual::DestroyAllAttachedMovableObjects (this=0x417e240, _sceneNode=0x7fffb4709278)
    at /home/caguero/workspace/gazebo_1.9/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc:263
#1  0x00007ffff6996189 in gazebo::rendering::Visual::~Visual (
    this=0x417e240, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /home/caguero/workspace/gazebo_1.9/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc:178
#2  0x00007ffff6996310 in gazebo::rendering::Visual::~Visual (
    this=0x417e240, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /home/caguero/workspace/gazebo_1.9/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc:193
#3  0x00007ffff4a2963c in boost::checked_delete<gazebo::rendering::Visual> (
    x=0x417e240) at /usr/include/boost/checked_delete.hpp:34
#4  0x00007ffff4a37ee8 in boost::detail::sp_counted_impl_p<gazebo::rendering::Visual>::dispose (this=0x418f2a0)
    at /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/detail/sp_counted_impl.hpp:78
#5  0x00007ffff685d7ec in boost::detail::sp_counted_base::release (
    this=0x418f2a0)
    at /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/detail/sp_counted_base_gcc_x86.hpp:146
#6  0x00007ffff685d87b in boost::detail::shared_count::~shared_count (
    this=0x418a888, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/detail/shared_count.hpp:371
#7  0x00007ffff685dc2a in boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::rendering::Visual>::~shared_ptr (this=0x418a880, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:328
#8  0x00007ffff69ac53a in boost::_bi::value<boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::rendering::Visual> >::~value (this=0x418a880, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /usr/include/boost/bind/bind.hpp:112
#9  0x00007ffff69ac554 in boost::_bi::storage1<boost::_bi::value<boost::shared---Type <return> to continue, or q <return> to quit---
_ptr<gazebo::rendering::Visual> > >::~storage1 (this=0x418a880, 
    __in_chrg=<optimized out>) at /usr/include/boost/bind/storage.hpp:40
#10 0x00007ffff69ac56e in boost::_bi::list1<boost::_bi::value<boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::rendering::Visual> > >::~list1 (this=0x418a880, 
    __in_chrg=<optimized out>) at /usr/include/boost/bind/bind.hpp:217

    op=boost::detail::function::destroy_functor_tag)

#18 0x00007ffff79043f6 in boost::function<void ()>::~function() (
    this=0x417d7a0, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /usr/include/boost/function/function_template.hpp:1048
#19 0x00007ffff79455f2 in gazebo::event::EventT<void ()>::~EventT() (
    this=0x7ffff7832310 <gazebo::event::Events::preRender>, 
    __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
```

title: Joint maker back to life

summary.raw:
This pull request includes the new redesign of the joint maker (courtesy of @iche033) contained in the model editor. I've fixed the mouse interaction problems and the sdf generation.

The original `JointMaker_TEST` segfaults after running (during tear down). I've commented some of the lines that apparently causes the problem for leaving the test in a stable state. The problem seems to be related with Ogre deallocating the sceneNode and some destructions that we do inside Gazebo. I've been looking into this but I'm not sure why this is happening. Suggestions are more than welcome. Here is a backtrace in case we want to tackle the problem here.


summary.html:
This pull request includes the new redesign of the joint maker (courtesy of @iche033) contained in the model editor. I've fixed the mouse interaction problems and the sdf generation.

The original JointMaker_TEST segfaults after running (during tear down). I've commented some of the lines that apparently causes the problem for leaving the test in a stable state. The problem seems to be related with Ogre deallocating the sceneNode and some destructions that we do inside Gazebo. I've been looking into this but I'm not sure why this is happening. Suggestions are more than welcome. Here is a backtrace in case we want to tackle the problem here.
